place.name: LLANDEVAUD
place.gazetteerText: LLANDEVAND, a chapelry in Llanmartin parish, Monmouth; 3 miles NNE of Llanwern r. station, and 4 E of Caerleon. Post town, Newport, Monmouth. The statistics are returned with the parish. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of Llandaff. Value, £40. Patron, the Bishop of Llandaff. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
